heading: The Spark (2019–2022)
content: For three years, I observed my cousin, a web developer, write code while I was asking questions but never touching an IDE. It was pure curiosity. In 2022, I bought my first computer (a relic with 2GB RAM) and took the plunge. Starting with C++ was brutal; I finished the course understanding nothing. But HTML changed everything. Seeing my work come to life on the UI hooked me instantly.

heading: The Silent Grind
content: I learned in isolation. No audience, no validation, just my cousin’s guidance and relentless self-teaching. I built projects I cared about, free from external expectations. The silence became my fuel.

heading: The Pivot: Frontend to Backend
content: After 1.5 years, I switched to backend development, a near-breaking point. Imposter syndrome hit hard: "Am I cut out for this?" But I recalibrated. If others could master it, so could I. Today, TypeScript and NestJS feel like second nature.

heading: Why I Code
content: I enjoy experiencing the flow state where I lose track of time, solving bugs, and watching ideas materialize on-screen. At the same time, problem-solving became a mindset: coding rewired my brain. Life’s challenges? Just "bugs" to debug and analyze, iterate, solve. Meanwhile, in an age of endless scrolling, coding taught me to value deep work.

heading: Tools & Philosophy
content: I now work with TypeScript, Next.js, and NestJS, though adaptability matters more than any stack. My mantra? Build, learn, repeat. Stuck? Solve it or step away, clarity follows patience.

heading: Beyond the Screen
content: Gym, friends, gaming, watching YouTube, reading books, learning languages, and going to university where I study English literature (despite initial resistance) honed my appreciation for logic and art.
